result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L Bowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.   Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with N.H.B. unless she consents in writing and Agent approves.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall comply with Waupaca County Case 22CV19.

timeConds.notes:
Jail time stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion. 
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth L Bowers
